Trauma History: The patient expressed feelings related to past gambling experiences, describing it as cathartic to write about losing everything.
History of Present Illness (HPI): The patient reported feeling better overall, engaging in free writing, practicing breathing exercises, and experiencing a slight improvement in sleep. They acknowledged having off days but felt more hopeful and are working on managing anger.
Psychosocial History: The patient mentioned feeling distant from their mother and expressed uncertainty about reaching out to reconnect.
Physiological Observations: The patient noted improvements in sleep quality after practicing breathing exercises.
Progress Evaluation: The patient feels positive about their progress with writing and plans to volunteer, indicating a willingness to engage in activities that promote well-being.
Therapeutic Interventions: The patient plans to continue free writing and has identified volunteering as a new therapeutic activity.
Next Steps: The patient intends to start volunteering at a food bank this weekend, expressing some nervousness but also optimism about the experience.
